intro: Libanothamnus arboreus, commonly known as the silky tree-fern, is a unique plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Cyatheaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and feathery fronds. The plant has a distinctive appearance with a smooth, fibrous trunk that resembles a tree fern. Its fronds are long, arching, and covered in soft, silky hairs, giving it a delicate, almost ethereal look. Libanothamnus arboreus thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
